name: Wyndham Skyline Tower

reviews.text: It is a very large and clean room! 2 mins walking distance to casinos and the boardwalk :-)
reviews.title: very nice!!

reviews.text: We were 3 couples and we had plenty of room. The kitchen is supplied with everything you would need to cook. The elevators were a little long to wait for but other than that...we had a very nice 'vacancy'...hahaha!
reviews.title: Wonderful stay! Room was perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Skyline from May 16th to 19th! we were 3 late 20's couples staying in a 2 bedroom suite. It was fantastic, none of us felt like we didin't have enough space. Beds were comfortable (even the sofa bed) kitchen and balcony were great. Staff was remarkable, always friendly and giving us great advice on where to go. The elevators were not as bad as other reviewers posted, as long as you weren't waiting for one during check in or check out time. The hotel is very well located near resorts casino( which by the way is the only casino where we won any money) and we tried quite a few. Grab the Jitney and you can pretty much go anywhere without moving your car. Parking is 6$ a day. with Valet. so we didin't move it until we left. You want to avoid the side streets of AC and mainly stay on the boardwalk and you won't have any problems. The pool is quite nice and they have a small hot tub outside which is fun. Also an activity center if you have kids. We actually rented some of their board games which are free (for a rainy day). The kitchen really is well equipped, a coffee maker is also in the room but you only get enough coffee for one day. So you have to buy some for 1$ downstairs. Which is understandable. The only thing to really consider if you should stay here or not is that they do not clean your room for you everyday like a hotel, this is a timeshare place, so unless you want to be pampered or don't want to clean up after yourself, this might not be the place for you. But like I said, we were 3 couples and no problems with even changing our own sheets. With that in mind, enjoy your stay. and don't waste your money anywhere but resorts casino. only place with 10$ tables. and the drinks don't taste watered down!
reviews.title: Enjoyed Our Stay

likes.liked: — The service from the staff, the cleanliness of the suite.

reviews.text: My husband and I spent 3 nights at the Wyndham Skyline Tower. When we arrived, we pulled up in front, our bags were immediately loaded unto a cart. They do have valet parking @ $6 @ day. If you want your car, you go to the bellman, give him your ticket and your car is brought down fairly fast. Our check in was fast. Our room was clean, plenty of towels, nice kitchen, nice balconey. The staff was always friendly, very organized and helpful. We were extremely satisfied with our stay. Last year we stayed at the Fantasea, which is located right on the boardwalk, that was convenient, but the rooms weren't as nice. At the Wyndham, its a short walk to the boardwalk. We took the Jitney when we went any distance from the hotel. They run constantly, its a fast ride to where you want to go, it sure was better than taking your car out and trying to find a place to park. We would gladly go back.
reviews.title: Wyndham Skyline, a good choice? All depends on why you're in AC

likes.disliked: — It was not connected to a casino

reviews.text: The Wyndham Skyline was a good choice for our dance troupe of nine families. We went down to Atlantic City for a competition and workshop and wanted a "family-friendly" environment where the kids could get together in the indoor pool and we could eat together as a group in our director's suite. There were 26 of us sharing five spacious suites. I would not suggest staying here if you want a weekend of gambling and nightly entertainment. I'm sure the casinos offer better deals and you can even get comped.
reviews.title: Great overall, with one minor issue

likes.disliked: — waiting for elevators and sometimes being crammed in elevators with too many people

reviews.text: I am a timeshare owner at this location and in the past my family had a great stay. We stayed here from July 3 through July 6. Problems began with long waits to get your car unloaded and parked. Check-in was smooth until you reached your condo to find that there were only 2 towels for 8 people. Towels weren't delivered until 10am Friday morning. Five of us had at least 4 hour drives after working all day. No showers that night. Things got worse. We were on the 26th floor and sometimes we waited more than an hour for an elevator and this wasn't during peak times. Don't visit this resort during peak times unless you don,t mind walking down 26 floors. I have stayed here numerous times and this experience was a nightmare.One good thing they did was to reduce the parking fee from $10 to $6. The only thing you didn't have to wait for was your car because it was waiting for you.
reviews.title: Totally disappointed

likes.disliked: — prolonged waits for one of 3 elevators

reviews.text: Bring walking shoes and catch elevators going up so you can ride back down!
reviews.title: Great Location, more than a hotel

likes.disliked: — elevators inadequate for amount of guest.

reviews.text: The Skyline Tower is located next to the Resorts Casino and Trumps Taj Mahal. The condos are spacious and include everything you need for a comfortable stay. The outdoor hot tub was our family's favorite way of spending the day and the pier amusement park was the trip's highlight for our four year old. I do have to mention to the elevator situation (long waits, often crowded) can be annoying at times, but once you get to where you're going, you quickly forget about it. The staff was mostly hospitable, except for one lady at the Activities desk. The resort takes care of the parking for $6 per day and your car arrives quickly after your request. Overall we were very pleased with our stay at this hotel
reviews.title: Wyndham - Disappointed

reviews.text: After reading the reviews, I was thrilled to learn of a well-rated family friendly hotel in Atlantic City. I pre-paid for two nights at the end of June.
reviews.title: Wonderful place/location for great family location

likes.liked: — The location, room quality, views, activities offered onsite...
likes.disliked: — Elevator really slow, High pressure Timeshare sales...

reviews.text: Maybe my expectations where too high. While the room, a one-bedroom with kitchen was spacious, there were so many other things that bothered me at the property that I was very disappointed in this selection. After traveling on the east coast for two weeks with my family and being very, very satisfied at similar properties (Hilton Garden Inn, Residence Inn, etc.), I would not have selected this Wyndham if I had know the following: inefficient elevators requiring very long waits (this property is being marketed as a time-share of sorts so there is a tremendous amount of people traffic), no daily maid service, way, way overly scented room-cleaning products that took at least 24 hours for the scent to go away, windows in the bedroom that wouldn't open (although there was a nice sliding door to the balcony in the living room), no coffee shop/restaurant on the property, wireless Internet on the 6th floor only (and mine didn't work and there was no "tech" support to help trouble shoot).
reviews.title: Great Girls Getaway

reviews.text: I'm a business traveler that had never visited Atlantic City so I decided to spend 3 nights on a discounted rate.
reviews.title: About Atlantic City and The Skyline

likes.liked: — Large, well equipped (although not very well appointed) condo/suite.
likes.disliked: — No traditional hotel services, dining, pub or gambling on the property.

reviews.text: If you are considering visiting Atlantic City a few things to consider. Obviously this is not Las Vegas that does a pretty good job at catering to families. 98% of this place is about gambling. There are some shows and so forth advertised but if you aren't into gambling you could become very bored. The casinos except for maybe the Borgota are mostly 4 walls, a roof and slot machines galore. Otherwise they are not your typical upscale "themed fanfaire" with shops, dining, things for the kids and exhibits. My point is if you think you can walk around and see the sites while your spouse is gambling you wont be happy very long.
reviews.title: Close to outlets, casinos, and jitney stop!

likes.liked: — Close to boardwalk and other casinos
likes.disliked: — Elevators took too long to get to 30th floor

reviews.text: Now the Skyline. First off this is not a full service hotel or casino. If room service, gambling, dining/drinking, and daily maid service in your hotel is your thing you should stay at one of the casino hotels. This is a timeshare property that also rents their large suites on a daily basis. (Do not pay more than $99.00 per day.)
reviews.title: Very Nice Get Away

likes.liked: — It was central to every type of entertainment, ie beach, boardwalk, shopping

reviews.text: When you check in you will be told to go over to another counter where you will receive a small packet of useful mini items and maps but you will also be asked to attend a "presentation about the hotel and its services" for 60 minutes and you'll receive $60.00 gambling money for your time. I declined and was never bothered about it the rest of my stay.
reviews.title: Just okay

likes.liked: — the friendly staff made the stay okay
likes.disliked: — the area & some of the people that were staying there

reviews.text: The Deluxe 1 BR condo was fairly nice. It had a well equipped kitchen, separate living room, outdoor balcony, and a small bathroom. The king sized bed wasn't great, I didn't use the kitchen at all and none of the rooms had wireless internet. (It's provided on the 6th floor and lobby.) both rooms had a large regular TV with DVD player in the living room and a smaller flat screen in the bedroom.

likes.liked: — I loved the Decor and the products left for the guests
likes.disliked: — The lack of a kitchen garbage and the drafty room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall the Wyndham Skyline tower is an ok resort. The location could be better as it's a block from the boardwalk but it also could be a lot worse (so this wasn't a big deal). The elevators are very slow (most likely due to staff going up and down all day with a special key that blocks out every floor except the one they are going to) I personally saw them doing this more then once, this needs to be addressed and stopped. The housecleaning staff seemed to be very nice and professional up until our last day, one woman in particular was very rude and unprofessional calling my girlfriend a not so nice word while she was cleaning our room. Due to the slow elevators we heard her entire rant about us (which we did not deserve) through the closed door. We complained about it but it still was a crappy way to end our vacation.
reviews.title: The room was nice... house keeping not so much.

likes.liked: — Spacious rooms, very comfortable and a whirlpool in the bedroom, very romantic.

reviews.text: The only down side was paying for parking which is $6.00 a day plus tip every time you want to use your car. The elevators are the slowest ever.
reviews.title: Great time, better than I expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is great it is a 5min walk to the board walk and beach. There is a food store about 20min. drive to get food for the week. The cheapest beer and food is at the Irish Pub you should check it out even if you are not Irish. It is cash only but it is only 1.90 for a beer and 2.50 for a mix drink. The food is good and very reasonable compared to the casinos. It was a first visit to A.C. and we would recomend it to everyone. There was alot to do besides just gambling.
reviews.title: Enjoyed the stay, but...
